Sentencas: The heat and species transport processes in a tubular type solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) that works in a cell stack were analyzed and modeled.
Titulo: Simulation of the chemical/electrochemical reactions and heat/mass transfer for a tubular SOFC in a stack

Sentencas: Since most of the single tubular SOFCs working in a cell stack share the same/similar chemical/electrochemical and heat/mass transfer conditions, it is plausible to assume that heat and species are not exchanged between one cell and its neighboring cells.
Titulo: Simulation of the chemical/electrochemical reactions and heat/mass transfer for a tubular SOFC in a stack

Sentencas: Therefore, a surrounding fuel flow space was outlined controllable by a specific single cell, for which zero flux was assumed at its boundary in neighborhood with other cells.
Titulo: Simulation of the chemical/electrochemical reactions and heat/mass transfer for a tubular SOFC in a stack

Sentencas: The numerical model subjects such a cell and its controllable fuel flow space to a two-dimensional analysis for the flow, heat/mass transfer and chemical/electrochemical performance.
Titulo: Simulation of the chemical/electrochemical reactions and heat/mass transfer for a tubular SOFC in a stack

Sentencas: Computations were performed for three different tubular SOFCs having practical operating results available from publications by different researchers.
Titulo: Simulation of the chemical/electrochemical reactions and heat/mass transfer for a tubular SOFC in a stack

Sentencas: The numerical results of the terminal voltages for those different SOFCs showed very good agreement with the published experimental data.
Titulo: Simulation of the chemical/electrochemical reactions and heat/mass transfer for a tubular SOFC in a stack

Sentencas: It is expectable that the proposed numerical model be used to significantly help the design and operation of a SOFC stack in practical applications.
Titulo: Simulation of the chemical/electrochemical reactions and heat/mass transfer for a tubular SOFC in a stack
